author: Staff Reporter
text:
Due to the prevailing weather, feed intake will not be higher in poultry and egg production will be at normal level.

Cloudy sky

A weather advisory bulletin issued by Agromet Field Unit of Veterinary College and Research Institute and Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai, said that the sky would be party cloudy with chance of isolated drizzling in the district.

Also, maximum and minimum temperature was expected to be 32 degree Celsius and 20 degree Celsius respectively. Cloudy sky was likely to keep the night temperature at 21 degree Celsius and chillness and fog formation would not occur for the next two days.

Egg production

The advisory said that the prevailing weather would be comfortable for the poultry and the egg production would be normal.

The advisory said that maize arrival was expected to be low and asked the farmers to procure good quality maize.
title: ‘Feed intake in poultry will not be high’
